result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth M. Wargo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay restitution in the amount of $1,032.50 and restitution surcharge. Restitution is subject to the Defendant's right to challenge.
---------------------------
**AMENDMENT 05-21-2015 - PURSUANT TO RESTITTION HEARING AND FINDINGS OF FACT FILED ON 05-18-2015 AND BY ORDER OF THE COURT, THE DEFENDANT is to pay restitution in the amount of $110.00. Restitution has been paid in full and disbursed to the victim through the Clerk of Courts Office.
---------------------------

Pay court costs and Department of Corrections Supervision Fees.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
-----------------------------
**AMENDMENT 05-21-2015 - PLEASE NOTE: Bond money that was held for restitution purposes has now been applied toward the defendant's fines and costs leaving a balance due of  $113.35.
-----------------------------

No violent contact with the victim.
-----------------------------
Continued counseling as recommended by the Agent.  Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.

records.addlTxt: Refund of $121.00 was sent to DOC Cashier's Unit for overpayment for Kenneth Wargo - Check Number 16366 - bv
Order Adopting Findings of Fact, Conclusions of Law from Restitution Hearing
Findings of Fact and Conclusion of Law From Restitution Hearing
In Court file

10:44 am Case called. Appearances made. 
Defendant Kenneth M. Wargo in court with attorney Francis R. Lettenberger. Prosecuting Attorney Valerian Powell in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Powell withdraws part of the claim regarding ambulance as long as defendant doesn't ask for payment on that. 
Attorney Lettenberger agrees that his client will not seek repayment on the ambulance bill. 
10:46 am Tonya Lynn Borger, duly sworn by clerk, testifies on direct exam of Attorney Powell. 
Exhibit one, patient statement, marked by clerk. 
Exhibit two, directions print out, marked by clerk. 
Attorney Powell offers Exhibit one, no objection.
Court receives Exhibit one. 
Attorney Powell offers Exhibit two, no objection. 
Court receives Exhibit two.
Exhibit 3, patient appointment receipt, marked by clerk. 
Attorney Powell offers Exhibit three, no objection. 
Court will receive Exhibit three. 
Court makes statement that the chiropractor records will be sealed. 
10:59 am Cross by Attorney Lettenberger. 
11:07 am Court questions witness. 
11:07 am Redirect by Attorney Powell. 
11:08 am Kenneth Wargo, duly sworn by clerk, testifies on direct exam of Attorney Lettenberger. 
11:11 am Cross by Attorney Powell. 
11:12 am Closing argument of Attorney Powell. 
11:14 am Closing argument of Attorney Lettenberger. 
11:17 am Rebuttle by Attorney Powell. 
Exhibit 4, Victim restitution request 2014CF290, court receives. 
11:18 am Court in recess.
Defendant's Notice of Motion for Restitution Hearing
Defendant Kenneth M. Wargo in court with attorney Francis R. Lettenberger.  Valerian A Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.
BOND QUASHED

Defendant Kenneth M. Wargo in court with attorney Francis R. Lettenberger.  Tracy L. McMiller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for March 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 4, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.  Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
Not guilty plea and trial reserved.

Defendant Kenneth M. Wargo in court with attorney Francis R. Lettenberger.  Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The defendant wishes to waive his prelminary hearing. Court goes over waiver form with the defendant. Information filed - reading waived. Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for October 20, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant Kenneth M. Wargo in court with attorney Francis R. Lettenberger.  Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion to modify bond by Attorney Lettenberger denied at this time. Formal written bond motion to be filed. Preliminary hearing requested. Minutes filed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 15, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

**AMENDMENT 08-13-2013: Defendant may have contact with his daughter (C.L.B.) pursuant to the CHIPS Order presently in place.**

Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH C.L.B. OR HER RESIDENCE.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
Defendant in court in custody with attorney Travis Schwantes/Edward Bailey for bond purposes only. Valerian Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. MInutes filed.
